metadata.synopsis: An HIV-positive Parisian (Cyril Collard) has unsafe sex with two people (Romane Bohringer, Carlos López) before and after they learn of his condition.

reviews: The film has a degree of candour and integrity which is exceptional in an industry which ordinarily relies on teamwork.

In his portrayal of a man sentenced to death but living life to the fullest, Collard has put together a compelling and original study of daring, dangerous, almost homicidal sexuality in these plague years.
One of the first and most audacious films about AIDS, in which director Collard cast himself in the lead because French actors were reportedly concerned about playing a bisexual, HIV character.
Bohringer makes the character real in countless details, and Laura's confusion and vulnerability undermine Collard's theme.
